Description: Blue glazed composition reis shabti of Henuttawy with black detail: a lappet-wig with a uraeus, a modelled face with traced eyes and one arm held across the chest with a whip; Hieroglyphic text on the apron.
Curator's comments: Published: Les amour d'une princesse égyptienne, Saint-Gérard 1997, p.143 [187].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1983 Aug-Oct, Stratford, Passmore Edwards Museum, Life & Death in Ancient Egypt 1997 May-Oct, Abbaye Saint-Gerard De Brogne, Le Roman de la momie 2019-2020 6 Jul–6 Jul, Wakefield Museum, Gateway to Eternity: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
